intro: Pingraea latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf pingraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Pingraea latifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
